docs.snippet: ON a Sunday afternoon in Quito, time is apt to move slowly for the visiting American. Through the day he has observed the life of this Ecuadorian capital, 9,000 feet up in the Andes, a city old when the Incas came. He has been to church, has watched...
docs.lead_paragraph: ON a Sunday afternoon in Quito, time is apt to move slowly for the visiting American. Through the day he has observed the life of this Ecuadorian capital, 9,000 feet up in the Andes, a city old when the Incas came. He has been to church, has watched the boys and girls at the noontime dance, has lunched, sat in the sun, had tea.

headline.main: Movies With a Latin Accent; South of the Rio Grande the screen turns up some surprises for Norteamericanos -- including some non-Hollywood merit.

docs.snippet: PARIS, Nov. 13 -- The delegations of Denmark, Norway and Uruguay submitted today a draft resolution that invited South Africa to collaborate more closely with the United Nations Trusteeship Council.

docs.abstract: Denmark, Norway and Uruguay resolution urges S Africa act more closely with UN, Trusteeship Council; hints that Assembly will not sanction incorporation of SW into S Africa

docs.snippet: Plans of the Park Department to place equestrian statues of two Latin-American heroes on landscaped sites at each end of the Avenue of the Americas were announced yesterday by Mayor O'Dwyer. The plans have been approved by the United States State...
docs.lead_paragraph: Plans of the Park Department to place equestrian statues of two Latin-American heroes on landscaped sites at each end of the Avenue of the Americas were announced yesterday by Mayor O'Dwyer. The plans have been approved by the United States State Department, which regards them as appropriate steps to stress the function of the thoroughfare as an emblem of Pan-American good-will.
docs.abstract: Buenos Aires to give replica of statue to NYC for installation in Av of Amers

headline.main: Statues of San Martin and Bolivar To Stand in Avenue of Americas; Mayor Announces Plans to Place One at Each End of the Thoroughfare, Renaming of Which Now Seems Less Likely

docs.snippet: PARIS, Nov. 16 -- The United Nations General Assembly's Trusteeship Committee completed its debate today on the long dispute over South Africa's administration of the Territory of Southwest Africa. Voting on the proposals before the committee was...
docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS, Nov. 16 -- The United Nations General Assembly's Trusteeship Committee completed its debate today on the long dispute over South Africa's administration of the Territory of Southwest Africa. Voting on the proposals before the committee was deferred until tomorrow.
docs.abstract: UN Gen Assembly Trusteeship Com, Paris, ends debate on Union of S Africa adm; Amb V L Pandit and Min E H Louw rev opposing arguments; voting deferred

docs.snippet: With industry profits running at an all-time high, there should be no hesitancy in re-imposing the excess profits tax, Senator Joseph C. O'Mahoney, Democrat, of Wyoming, declared yesterday. However, the tax should be so devised, he said, to encourage...
docs.lead_paragraph: With industry profits running at an all-time high, there should be no hesitancy in re-imposing the excess profits tax, Senator Joseph C. O'Mahoney, Democrat, of Wyoming, declared yesterday. However, the tax should be so devised, he said, to encourage investment of private capital in new competitive enterprise.
docs.abstract: Sen O'Mahoney urges excess profits tax be set to encourage private capital investment

headline.main: O'MAHONEY FAVORS EXCESS PROFIT TAX; Senator Says With Net All-Time High There Should Be No Hesitancy in Enactment BUT WOULD AID INVESTING Says Rates Should Be Devised to Encourage Private Capital in Talk Before Wool Men O'MAHONEY FAVORS EXCESS PROFIT TAX

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18 (AP) -- Press Wireless, Inc., proposed today to the Federal Communications Commission a rise of one to two cents a word in most of its overseas press rates.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18 (AP) -- Press Wireless, Inc., proposed today to the Federal Communications Commission a rise of one to two cents a word in most of its overseas press rates.
docs.abstract: Press Wireless seeks rate rise on overseas service, FCC
